original: tadvidhatvād akhilo 'nātmavid aprāptapuruṣārthatayā kṛpaṇo bhavati /
analyzed: tadvidha tvāt akhilaḥ na ātma vid aprāpta puruṣa artha tayā kṛpaṇaḥ bhavati
translated: Because of being of that kind, all who do not know the Self become misers by not attaining the human goal.

original: yo vā etad akṣaram gārgy aviditvā asmāl lokāt praiti sa kṛpaṇa BAU / / iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vai etat akṣaram gārgi a viditvā asmāt lokāt praiti sa iti śruteḥ
translated: Or, as is declared in the Upanisad, 'He who departs from this world without knowing this syllable, O Gargi, departs as a miserable creature.'

original: tasya bhāvaḥ kārpaṇyam anātmādhyāsavattvaṃ tannimitto 'smin janmany eta eva madīyās
analyzed: tasya bhāvaḥ kārpaṇyam anātma adhyāsavat tvam tad nimittaḥ u smin janmani ete eva madīyāḥ
translated: The state of that is miserableness, the state of having the non-Self superimposed, and on account of that, in this birth, this very idea arises: 'These are my own people,'

original: teṣu hateṣu kiṃ jīvitenety abhiniveśarūpo mamatālakṣaṇo doṣas tenopahatas tiraskṛtaḥ
analyzed: teṣu hateṣu kim jīvitena iti abhiniveśa rūpaḥ mamatā lakṣaṇaḥ doṣaḥ tena upahataḥ tiraskṛtaḥ
translated: 'When they are killed, what is the use of life?' - this is the fault in the form of attachment, characterized by self-love. He is struck down, obscured,

original: svabhāvaḥ kṣātro yuddhodyogalakṣaṇo yasya sa tathā /
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ kṣātraḥ yuddha udyoga lakṣaṇaḥ yasya sa tathā
translated: by that. He whose natural state, characterized by the exertion for battle, is thus, he is like that.

original: dharme viṣaye nirṇāyakapramāṇaādarśanāt saṃmūḍhaṃ kim eteṣāṃ vadho dharmaḥ kim etatparipālanaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: dharme viṣaye nirṇāyaka pramāṇa ādarśanāt saṃmūḍham kim eteṣām vadhaḥ dharmaḥ kim etad paripālanam dharmaḥ
translated: Since there is no authoritative means of knowledge to decide in the matter of Dharma, his mind is confused, doubting: 'Is the killing of these people Dharma? Or is the protection of them Dharma?'

original: tathā kiṃ pṛthvīparipālanaṃ dharmaḥ kiṃ vā yathāvasthito 'raṇyanivāsa eva dharma ity ādisaṃśayair vyāptaṃ ceto yasya sa tathā /
analyzed: tathā kim pṛthvī paripālanam dharmaḥ kim vā yathā avasthitaḥ raṇya nivāsaḥ eva dharmaḥ iti ādi saṃśayaiḥ vyāptam cetaḥ yasya sa tathā
translated: Similarly, 'Is the protection of the earth Dharma? Or is the state of dwelling in the forest as it is Dharma?' - his mind is pervaded by such doubts. He who is like that,

original: na caitad vidmaḥ kataran no garīya ity atra vyākhyātam
analyzed: na ca etat vidmaḥ katarat naḥ garīyaḥ iti atra vyākhyātam
translated: and we do not know which is better for us' - this has been explained here.

original: etat / evaṃvidhaḥ sann ahaṃ tvā tvām idānīṃ pṛcchāmi śreya ity anuṣaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: etat evaṃvidhaḥ san aham tvā tvām idānīm pṛcchāmi śreyaḥ iti anuṣaṅgaḥ
translated: Being like this, I now ask you, O best of the twice-born, what is better for me. The connection is understood.

original: ato yan niścitam aikāntikam ātyantikaṃ ca śreyaḥ paramapumarthabhūtaṃ phalaṃ syāt tan me mahyaṃ brūhi /
analyzed: atas yat niścitam aikāntikam ātyantikam ca śreyaḥ parama pumartha bhūtam phalam syāt tat me mahyam brūhi
translated: Therefore, tell me that which is certain, absolute, and eternal, which would be the fruit that is the highest human goal.

original: sādhanānantaram avaśyambhāvitvam aikāntikatavaṃ /
analyzed: sādhana anantaram avaśyambhāvi tvam aikāntika tavam
translated: Being necessarily present immediately after the means is the quality of being absolute.

original: jātasyāvināśa ātyantikatvam /
analyzed: jātasya avināśe ātyantika tvam
translated: Being indestructible after being produced is the quality of being eternal.

original: yathā hy auṣadhe kṛte kadācid roganivṛttir na bhaved api jātāpi ca roganivṛttiḥ punar api rogotpattyā vināśyate /
analyzed: yathā hi auṣadhe kṛte kadācid roga nivṛttiḥ na bhavet api jātā api ca roga nivṛttiḥ punar api roga utpattyā vināśyate
translated: For, even after a medicine has been administered, the disease may not be cured. And even if the disease is cured, it may be destroyed again by the recurrence of the disease.

original: evaṃ kṛte 'pi yāge pratibandhavaśāt svargo na bhaved api jāto 'pi svargo duḥkhākrānto naśyati ceti naikāntikatvam ātyantikatvaṃ vā tayoḥ /
analyzed: evam kṛte pi yāge pratibandha vaśāt svargaḥ na bhavet api jātaḥ pi svargaḥ duḥkha ākrāntaḥ naśyati ca iti na aikāntika tvam ātyantika tvam vā tayoḥ  /
translated: Similarly, even if a sacrifice has been performed, heaven may not occur due to obstacles. And even if heaven has occurred, it may be destroyed by the onslaught of suffering. Thus, they are not absolute or eternal.

original: tad uktam
analyzed: tat uktam
translated: This is stated:

original: duḥkhatrayābhighātāj jijñāsā tadapaghātake hetau /
analyzed: duḥkha traya abhighātāt jijñāsā tad apaghātake hetau
translated: The inquiry is due to the attack of the three kinds of suffering, into the means of removing that.

original: dṛṣṭe sāpārthā cen naikāntātyantato 'bhāvāt // Sa /K / iti /
analyzed: dṛṣṭe sā apārthā ced na ekānta atyantataḥ bhāvāt iti
translated: If it is said that it is useless when seen, it is not so, because of the absence of absolute and eternal [means]. (S.S.)

original: dṛṣṭavad ānuśravikaḥ sa hy avaiśuddhikṣayātiśayayuktaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa vat ānuśravikaḥ sa hi a vaiśuddhi kṣaya atiśaya yuktaḥ
translated: The Vedic [means] is like the seen [means], for it is associated with impurity, destruction, and excess.

original: tadviparītaḥ śreyān vyaktāvyaktajñavijñānāt // Sa /K / iti /
analyzed: tad viparītaḥ śreyān vyakta avyakta jña vijñānāt sak iti
translated: The opposite of that is better, due to the knowledge of the manifest, unmanifest, and the knower. (S.S.)

original: nanu tvaṃ mama sakhā na tu śiṣyo 'ta āha śiṣyas te 'ham iti /
analyzed: nanu tvam mama sakhā na tu śiṣyo te āha śiṣyaḥ te ham iti
translated: But you are my friend, not a disciple. Therefore he says, I am your disciple.

original: tvadanuśāsanayogyatvād ahaṃ tava śiṣya eva bhavāmi na sakhā nyūnajñānatvāt /
analyzed: tvad anuśāsana yogya tvāt aham tava śiṣyaḥ eva bhavāmi na sakhā nyūna jñāna tvāt
translated: Because I am fit for your instruction, I become your disciple only, not a friend, due to having less knowledge.

original: atas tvāṃ prapannaṃ śaraṇāgataṃ māṃ śādhi śikṣaya karuṇayā na tv aśiṣyatvaśaṅkayopekṣaṇīyo 'ham ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: atas tvām prapannam śaraṇa āgatam mām śādhi śikṣaya karuṇayā na tu a śiṣya tva śaṅkayā upekṣaṇīyaḥ ham iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, instruct me who have come to you for refuge, with compassion, and do not ignore me out of doubt that I am not a disciple. This is the meaning.

original: etena tad vijñānārthaṃ sa gurum evābhigacchet samitpāṇiḥ śrotriyaṃ brahmaniṣṭham ṃuṇḍU / / /
analyzed: etena tat vijñāna artham sa gurum eva abhigacchet samidh pāṇiḥ śrotriyam brahma niṣṭham ṃuṇḍu
translated: By this, he shows the meaning of the scripture that teaches approaching the teacher, such as: For the sake of that knowledge, he should approach the teacher himself with fuel in hand, a learned Brahmin devoted to Brahman. (Mundaka Upanishad 1.2.1)

original: bhṛgur vai vāruṇiḥ /
analyzed: bhṛguḥ vai vāruṇiḥ
translated: Bhrigu, the son of Varuna,

original: varuṇaṃ pitaram upasasāra /
analyzed: varuṇam pitaram upasasāra
translated: approached his father Varuna,

original: adhīhi bhagavo brahmeti TaittU / ity ādigurūpasattipratipādakaḥ śrutyartho darśitaḥ ////
analyzed: adhīhi bhagavaḥ brahma iti iti ādi guru upasatti pratipādakaḥ śruti arthaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: saying Teach me, O Lord, about Brahman. (Taiitiriya Upanishad 2.1) and so on.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: nanu tarhi sopapattikaṃ śāstrārthaṃ tvam eva bruvāṇaḥ kṣatriyo bhūtvā bhikṣāṭanaṃ niścinoṣi tarhy alaṃ maduktyeti tatrāha kārpaṇyeti /
analyzed: nanu tarhi sa upapattikam śāstra artham tvam eva bruvāṇaḥ kṣatriyaḥ bhūtvā bhikṣāṭanam niścinoṣi tarhi alam mad uktyā iti tatra āha kārpaṇya iti
translated: If so, then you, who speak the meaning of the scriptures with reasoning, having become a Kshatriya, are determined to wander for alms. Then enough of my speaking. In that case, he says weakness etc.

original: svābhāvikasya śauryasya tyāga eva me kārpaṇyam /
analyzed: svābhāvikasya śauryasya tyāgaḥ eva me kārpaṇyam
translated: The abandonment of natural heroism is my weakness.

original: dharmasya sūkṣmā gatir ity ato dharmavyavasthāyām apy ahaṃ mūḍhabuddhir evāsmi /
analyzed: dharmasya sūkṣmā gatiḥ iti atas dharma vyavasthāyām api aham mūḍha buddhiḥ evā asmi
translated: The course of Dharma is subtle. Therefore, I am indeed of deluded intellect even in the matter of determining Dharma.

original: atas tvam eva niścitya śreyo brūhi /
analyzed: atas tvam eva niścitya śreyaḥ brūhi
translated: Therefore, you yourself decide and tell me what is good.

original: nanu madvācas tvaṃ paṇḍatamānitvena khaṇḍayasi cet /
analyzed: nanu mad vācaḥ tvam paṇḍata māni tvena khaṇḍayasi ced
translated: But if you reject my words out of pride in your own learning,

original: kathaṃ brūyām /
analyzed: katham brūyām
translated: how can I speak?

original: tatrāha śiṣyas te 'ham asmi /
analyzed: tatra āha śiṣyaḥ te ham asmi
translated: To that he says: I am your disciple.

original: nātaṃ paraṃ vṛthā khaṇḍayāmīti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: na atam param vṛthā khaṇḍayāmi iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is: I do not uselessly reject that.

original: baladevaḥ / atha tad vijñānārthaṃ sa gurum evābhigacchet samitpāṇiḥ śrotriyaṃ brahmaniṣṭham ṃuṇḍU / / /
analyzed: baladevaḥ atha tat vijñāna artham sa gurum eva abhigacchet samidh pāṇiḥ śrotriyam brahma niṣṭham ṃuṇḍu
translated: Balarama. Then, in order to know that, he should approach the teacher himself with fuel in hand, a learned Brahmin devoted to Brahman.

original: ācāryavān puruṣo veda Chā / / ity ādi śrutisiddhāṃ gurūpasattiṃ darśayati kārpaṇyeti /
analyzed: ācāryavān puruṣaḥ veda chā iti ādi śruti siddhām guru upasattim darśayati kārpaṇya iti
translated: He shows the approach to the teacher established by the Vedas, such as A person with a teacher knows... (Chandogya Upanishad 6.1.3), with the word poverty.

original: yo vā etad akṣaram gārgy aviditvā asmāl lokāt praiti sa kṛpaṇa BAU / / iti śravaṇād abrahmavittvaṃ kārpaṇyam /
analyzed: yaḥ vai etat akṣaram gārgi a viditvā asmāt lokāt praiti sa iti śravaṇāt a brahma vid tvam kārpaṇyam
translated: Because of the statement One who departs from this world without knowing that syllable, O Gargi, he departs as a poor man (Chandogya Upanishad 4.10.5), poverty is the state of not knowing Brahman.

original: tena hetunā yo doṣo yān eva hatveti bandhuvargam amatālakṣaṇas tenopahatasvabhāvo yuddhaspṛhālakṣaṇaḥ svadharmo yasya saḥ /
analyzed: tena hetunā yaḥ doṣaḥ yān eva hatvā iti bandhu vargam amatā lakṣaṇaḥ tena upahata svabhāvaḥ yuddha spṛhā lakṣaṇaḥ svadharmaḥ yasya saḥ
translated: By that cause, the fault, the nature afflicted by that, which is characterized by the desire for battle, is the duty of one who has that.

original: dharme saṃmūḍhaṃ kṣatriyasya me yuddhaṃ svadharmas tad vihāya bhikṣāṭanaṃ vety evaṃ sandihānaṃ ceto yasya saḥ /
analyzed: dharme saṃmūḍham kṣatriyasya me yuddham svadharmaḥ tat vihāya bhikṣāṭanam vā iti evam sandihānam cetaḥ yasya saḥ
translated: He whose mind is confused about dharma, doubting whether war is the duty of a kshatriya or whether begging is the duty by abandoning that [war].🔽

original: īdṛśaḥ sann ahaṃ tvām idānīṃ pṛcchāmi tasmān niścitaṃ ekāntikaṃ ātyantikaṃ yan me śreyaḥ syāt tat tvaṃ brūhi /🔽sādhanottaram avaśyaṃbhāvitvaṃ aikāntikatvaṃ /
analyzed: īdṛśaḥ san aham tvām idānīm pṛcchāmi tasmāt niścitam ekāntikam ātyantikam yat me śreyaḥ syāt tat tvam brūhi  sādhana uttaram avaśyaṃbhāvi tvam aikāntika tvam
translated: He whose mind is confused about dharma, doubting whether war is the duty of a kshatriya or whether wandering for alms is, being such, I now ask you. Therefore, tell me decisively, conclusively, what would be best for me.🔽Necessity of accomplishment is conclusiveness.

original: bhūtasyāvināśitvaṃ
analyzed: bhūtasya avināśi tvam
translated: Non-destruction of what has come to be is

original: ātyantikatvam /
analyzed: ātyantika tvam
translated: eternality.

original: nanu śaraṇāgatasyopadeśaḥ tad vijñānārthaṃ sa gurum evābhigacchet ity ādiśruteḥ /
analyzed: nanu śaraṇa āgatasya upadeśaḥ tat vijñāna artham sa gurum eva abhigacchet iti ādi śruteḥ
translated: But isn't instruction for one who has taken refuge? For the scripture says, For the sake of that knowledge, he should approach the teacher alone, and so on.

original: sakhāyaṃ tvāṃ katham upadiśāmīti cet tatrāha śiṣyas te 'ham iti /
analyzed: sakhāyam tvām katham upadiśāmi iti ced tatra āha śiṣyaḥ te ham iti
translated: If it is asked how can I instruct you as a friend, he says, I am your disciple.

original: śādhi śikṣaya ////
analyzed: śādhi śikṣaya
translated: Instruct, teach.

original: BhG /🔽na hi prapaśyāmi mamāpanudyād
analyzed: bhg  na hi prapaśyāmi mama apanudyāt
translated: BhG.🔽For I do not see anything that would remove this grief

original: yac chokam ucchoṣaṇam indriyāṇām /
analyzed: yat śokam ucchoṣaṇam indriyāṇām
translated: which is drying up my senses.

original: avāpya bhūmāv asapatnam ṛddhaṃ
analyzed: avāpya bhūmau asapatnam ṛddham
translated: Having obtained sovereignty on earth free from rivals and prosperous,

original: rājyaṃ surāṇām api cādhipatyam ////
analyzed: rājyam surāṇām api ca ādhipatyam
translated: and even lordship over the gods.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tvam eva vicārya yad yuktaṃ tat kurv iti cet /
analyzed: eva       kuru
translated: If it is said that you should consider and do what is proper,

original: tatrāha na hi prapaśyāmīti /
analyzed: tatra āha na hi prapaśyāmi iti
translated: in that case he says, For I do not see, etc.

original: indriyāṇām ucchoṣaṇam atiśoṣaṇakaraṃ madīyaṃ śokaṃ yat karma apanudyāt apanayet tad ahaṃ na prapaśyāmīti /
analyzed: indriyāṇām ucchoṣaṇam ati śoṣaṇa karam madīyam śokam yat karma apanudyāt apanayet tat aham na prapaśyāmi iti
translated: I do not see that act by which my grief, which is the drying up, the excessive drying up of the senses, would be removed, would be taken away.

original: yadyapi bhūmau niṣkaṇṭakaṃ samṛddhaṃ rājyaṃ prāpsyāmi /
analyzed: yadi api bhūmau niṣkaṇṭakam samṛddham rājyam prāpsyāmi
translated: Even if I were to obtain a kingdom on earth free from thorns and prosperous,

original: tathā surendratvam api yadi prāpsyāmi evam abhīṣṭaṃ tat tat sarvam avāpyāpi śokāpanodanopāyaṃ na prapaśyāmīty anvayaḥ ////
analyzed: tathā sura indra tvam api yadi prāpsyāmi evam abhīṣṭam tat tat sarvam avāpya api śoka apanodana upāyam na prapaśyāmi iti anvayaḥ
translated: and even if I were to obtain the lordship of the gods, having obtained all that which is so desired, I do not see a means of removing grief. This is the sequence.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: nanu svayam eva tvaṃ śreyo vicāraya śrutasampanno 'si kiṃ paraśiṣyatvenety ata āha nahīti /
analyzed: nanu svayam eva tvam śreyaḥ vicāraya śruta sampannaḥ si kim para śiṣya tvena iti atas āha nahi iti
translated: But you yourself should consider what is best for you. You are endowed with learning. What is the use of being a disciple of another? To this he says: Not, etc.

original: yacchreyaḥ prāptaṃ satkartṛ mama śokam apanudyād apanuden nivārayet tan na paśyāmi
analyzed: yat śreyaḥ prāptam satkartṛ mama śokam apanudyāt apanudet nivārayet tat na paśyāmi
translated: I do not see that which, when obtained, would remove, would take away my grief,

original: hi yasmāt tasmān māṃ śādhīti so 'haṃ bhagavaḥ śocāmi taṃ mā bhagavāñ chokasya pāraṃ
analyzed: hi yasmāt tasmāt mām śādhi iti saḥ ham bhagavaḥ śocāmi tam mā bhagavān śokasya pāram
translated: for, since that is so, therefore instruct me, O Lord. I grieve, O Lord. May the Lord lead me across the ocean of grief.

original: tārayatu ChāU / / iti śrutyartho darśitaḥ /
analyzed: tārayatu chāu iti śruti arthaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: Thus the meaning of the Upanishad is shown.

original: śokānapanode ko doṣa ity āśaṅkya tadviśeṣaṇam āha indriyāṇām ucchoṣaṇam iti /
analyzed: śoka anapanode kaḥ doṣaḥ iti āśaṅkya tad viśeṣaṇam āha indriyāṇām ucchoṣaṇam iti
translated: Fearing that the question might arise as to what the fault is in not removing grief, he specifies it by saying: the drying up of the senses, etc.

original: sarvadā santāpakaram ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sarvadā santāpa karam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: always causing distress.

original: nanu yuddhe prayatamānasya tava śokanivṛttir bhaviṣyati jeṣyasi cet tadā rājyaprāptyā dvāv etau puruṣau loke ity ādidharmaśāstrād ity āśaṅkyāha
analyzed: nanu yuddhe prayatamānasya tava śoka nivṛttiḥ bhaviṣyati jeṣyasi ced tadā rājya prāptyā dvau etau puruṣau loke iti ādi dharmaśāstrāt iti āśaṅkya āha
translated: But if you strive in battle, you will remove sorrow if you win, then by attaining the kingdom, as stated in the Dharma scriptures such as There are two kinds of men in the world... - thinking this, he says

original: avāpyety ādinā /
analyzed: avāpya iti ādinā
translated: Even if I attain and so on.

original: śatruvarjitaṃ sasyādisampannaṃ ca rājyaṃ tathā surāṇām ādhipatyaṃ hiraṇyagarbhatvaparyantam aiśvaryam avāpya sthitasyāpi mama yac chokam
analyzed: śatru varjitam sasya ādi sampannam ca rājyam tathā surāṇām ādhipatyam hiraṇyagarbha tva paryantam aiśvaryam avāpya sthitasya api mama yat śokam
translated: Even if I attain a kingdom free from enemies and rich in crops, etc., and the lordship of the gods, and sovereignty up to the state of Hiranyagarbha, I do not see that sorrow

original: apanudyāt tan na paśyāmīty anvayaḥ /
analyzed: apanudyāt tat na paśyāmi iti anvayaḥ
translated: would be removed. This is the continuation.

original: tad yatheha karmajito lokaḥ kṣīyata evam evāmutra puṇyajito lokaḥ kṣīyate Chā / / iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā iha karma jitaḥ lokaḥ kṣīyate evam eva amutra puṇya jitaḥ lokaḥ kṣīyate chā iti śruteḥ
translated: As it is said in the scriptures: Just as the world conquered by action here perishes, so the world conquered by merit there perishes.

original: yatkṛtakaṃ tadanityam ity anumānāt pratyakṣeṇāpy aihikānāṃ vināśadarśanāc ca naihika
analyzed: yat kṛtakam tat anityam iti anumānāt pratyakṣeṇa api aihikānām vināśa darśanāt ca na aihika
translated: And by inference: What is artificial is impermanent. And by direct perception: The destruction of what is here is seen. Therefore, neither the enjoyment here

original: āmutriko vā bhogaḥ śokanivartakaḥ kintu svasattākāle 'pi bhogapāratantryādinā
analyzed: āmutrikaḥ vā bhogaḥ śoka nivartakaḥ kintu sva sattā kāle pi bhoga pāratantrya ādinā
translated: nor the enjoyment hereafter removes sorrow. But even at the time of its own existence, due to dependence on enjoyment, etc.,

original: vināśakāle 'pi vicchedāc chokajanaka eveti na yuddhaṃ śokanivṛttaye 'nuṣṭheyam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: vināśa kāle pi vicchedāt śoka janakaḥ evā iti na yuddham śoka nivṛttaye nuṣṭheyam iti arthaḥ
translated: Even at the time of destruction, it is only the cause of sorrow due to separation. Therefore, the meaning is that war should not be undertaken for the cessation of sorrow.

original: etenehāmutrabhogavirāgo 'dhikāriviśeṣaṇatvena darśitaḥ ////
analyzed: etena iha amutra bhoga virāgaḥ dhikāri viśeṣaṇa tvena darśitaḥ
translated: By this, detachment from enjoyment here and hereafter is shown as a qualification of the qualified person.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: nanu mayi tava sakhyabhāva eva /
analyzed: nanu mayi tava sakhya bhāvaḥ eva
translated: Well, your attitude towards me is only that of friendship,

original: na tu gauravam /
analyzed: na tu gauravam
translated: not respect.

original: atas tvāṃ katham ahaṃ śiṣyaṃ karomi /
analyzed: atas tvām katham aham śiṣyam karomi
translated: Therefore, how can I make you my disciple?

original: tasmād yatra tava gauravaṃ taṃ kam api dvaipāyanādikaṃ prapadyasva ity ata āha na hīti /
analyzed: tasmāt yatra tava gauravam tam kam api dvaipāyana ādikam prapadyasva iti atas āha na hi iti
translated: Therefore, go to someone else, like Dvaipayana, whom you respect. To this, he says, No, etc.

original: mama śokam apanudyāt dūrīkuryād evaṃ janaṃ na prakarṣeṇa paśyāmi trijagaty ekaṃ tvāṃ vinā /
analyzed: mama śokam apanudyāt dūrīkuryāt evam janam na prakarṣeṇa paśyāmi trijagati ekam tvām vinā
translated: I do not see anyone else in the three worlds except you who could remove my sorrow, i.e., drive it away.

original: svasmād adhikabuddhimantaṃ bṛhaspatim api na jānāmīty ataḥ śokārta eva khalu kaṃ prapadyeya iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: svasmāt adhika buddhimantam bṛhaspatim api na jānāmi iti atas śoka ārtaḥ eva khalu kam prapadyeya iti bhāvaḥ
translated: I do not know even Brihaspati, who is more intelligent than myself. Therefore, I am indeed sorrowful. To whom should I go? This is the idea.

original: yad yataḥ śokād indriyāṇām ucchoṣaṇaṃ mahānidāghāt kṣudrasarasām iva utkarṣeṇa śoṣo bhavati /
analyzed: yat yatas śokāt indriyāṇām ucchoṣaṇam mahā nidāghāt kṣudra sarasām iva utkarṣeṇa śoṣaḥ bhavati
translated: From which sorrow, the drying up of the senses, like the drying up of small ponds by a great drought, takes place with intensity.

original: nanu tarhi sāmprataṃ tvaṃ śokārta eva khalu yudhyasva /
analyzed: nanu tarhi sāmpratam tvam śoka ārtaḥ eva khalu yudhyasva
translated: Well then, you are indeed sorrowful now. Fight!

original: tataś caitān jitvā rājyaṃ prātavatas tava rājyabhogābhiniveśenaiva śoko 'payāsyatīty āha avāpyeti /
analyzed: tatas ca etān jitvā rājyam tava rājya bhoga abhiniveśena eva śokaḥ u payāsyati iti āha avāpya iti
translated: And then, having conquered them and obtained your kingdom, your grief will be removed by your attachment to the enjoyment of the kingdom, thus he says 'having obtained' etc.

original: bhūmau niṣkaṇṭakaṃ rājyaṃ svarge surāṇām ādhipatyaṃ vā prāpyāpi sthitasya mamendriyāṇām etad ucchoṣaṇam evety arthaḥ ////
analyzed: bhūmau niṣkaṇṭakam rājyam svarge surāṇām ādhipatyam vā prāpya api sthitasya mama indriyāṇām etat ucchoṣaṇam eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: even having obtained a kingdom on earth free from thorns, or lordship over the gods in heaven, I would still be in a state of drying up of the senses.

original: baladevaḥ / nanu tvaṃ śāstrajño 'si svahitaṃ vicāryānutiṣṭha /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu tvam sva hitam vicārya anutiṣṭha
translated: Balarama: Well, you are a knower of the scriptures. Having considered what is good for you, act accordingly.

original: sakhyur me śiṣyaḥ kathaṃ bhaver iti cet tatrāha na hīti /
analyzed: sakhyuḥ me śiṣyaḥ katham bhaveḥ iti ced tatra āha na hi iti
translated: If you ask, 'How can I be a friend's disciple?', he says 'not' etc.

original: yat karma mama śokam apanudyād dūrīkuryāt tad ahaṃ na prapaśyāmi /
analyzed: yat karma mama śokam apanudyāt dūrīkuryāt tat aham na prapaśyāmi
translated: I do not see that action which would remove my grief, which would keep it away.

original: śokaṃ viśinaṣṭi indriyāṇām ucchoṣaṇam iti /
analyzed: śokam viśinaṣṭi indriyāṇām ucchoṣaṇam iti
translated: He specifies grief as 'drying up of the senses'.

original: tasmāc chokavināśāya tvāṃ prapanno 'smīti /
analyzed: tasmāt śoka vināśāya tvām prapannaḥ smi iti
translated: Therefore, I have come to you for the destruction of grief.

original: itthaṃ ca so 'haṃ bhagavaḥ śocāmi taṃ māṃ bhavān śokasya pāraṃ tārayatu iti śrutyartho darśitaḥ /
analyzed: ittham ca saḥ ham bhagavaḥ śocāmi tam mām bhavān śokasya pāram tārayatu iti śruti arthaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: Thus, O Lord, I grieve. May you lead me across the ocean of grief. Thus the meaning of the Upanishad is shown.

original: nanu tvam adhunā śokākulaḥ prapadyase yuddhāt sukhasamṛddhilābhe viśoko bhaviṣyasīti cet tatrāha avāpyeti /
analyzed: nanu tvam adhunā śoka ākulaḥ prapadyase yuddhāt sukha samṛddhi lābhe viśokaḥ bhaviṣyasi iti ced tatra āha avāpya iti
translated: If you ask, 'But now you are overwhelmed with grief and you are coming. When you obtain happiness and prosperity through war, you will become griefless', he says 'having obtained' etc.

original: yadi yuddhe vijayī syāṃ tadā bhūmāv asapatnaṃ niṣkaṇṭakaṃ rājyaṃ prāpya yadi ca tatra
analyzed: yadi yuddhe vijayī syām tadā bhūmau asapatnam niṣkaṇṭakam rājyam prāpya yadi ca tatra
translated: If I were to be victorious in battle, then having obtained a kingdom on earth free from rivals and thorns, and if I were to be killed there,

original: hataḥ syāṃ tadā svarge surāṇām ādhipatyaṃ prāpya sthitasya me viśokatvaṃ na bhaved ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: hataḥ syām tadā svarge surāṇām ādhipatyam prāpya sthitasya me viśoka tvam na bhavet iti arthaḥ
translated: then having attained lordship over the gods in heaven, I would not have freedom from sorrow. This is the meaning.

original: tad yatheha karmajito lokaḥ kṣīyata evam evāmutra puṇyajito lokaḥ kṣīyate ChāU🔽iti śruter naihikaṃ pāratrikaṃ vā yuddhalabdhaṃ sukhaṃ śokāpahaṃ tasmāt tādṛśam🔽eva śreyastvaṃ brūhīti na yuddhaṃ śokaharam // //
analyzed: tat yathā iha karma jitaḥ lokaḥ kṣīyate evam eva amutra puṇya jitaḥ lokaḥ kṣīyate chāu  iti śruteḥ naihikam pāratrikam vā yuddha labdham sukham śoka apaham tasmāt tādṛśam  eva śreyaḥ tvam brūhi iti na yuddham śoka haram
translated: Just as in this world, the world conquered by action is destroyed, in the same way, the world conquered by merit in the next world is destroyed.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Thus, because of this Vedic text, the happiness obtained through battle, whether in this world or the next, does not remove sorrow. Therefore, tell me about that which is truly the highest good, which is not battle that removes sorrow.

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: evam uktvā hṛṣīkeśaṃ guḍākeśaḥ parantapaḥ /
analyzed: evam uktvā hṛṣīkeśam guḍākeśaḥ parantapaḥ
translated: Having thus spoken to Hrishikesha, Gudakesha, the scorcher of enemies,

original: na yotsya iti govindam uktvā tūṣṇīṃ babhūva ha ////
analyzed: na yotsye iti govindam uktvā tūṣṇīm babhūva ha
translated: said to Govinda, I will not fight, and remained silent.

original: śrīdharaḥ / evam uktvārjunaḥ kiṃ kṛtavān ity apekṣāyāṃ sañjaya uvāca evam ity ādi /
translated: Sridhar: What did Arjuna do after saying this? In anticipation of this question, Sanjaya says evam etc.

original: spaṣṭārthaḥ ////
analyzed: spaṣṭa arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is clear.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: tadanantaram arjunaḥ kiṃ kṛtavān iti dhṛtarāṣṭrākāṅkṣāyāṃ sañjaya uvāca evam ity ādi /
analyzed: tad anantaram arjunaḥ kim kṛtavān iti dhṛtarāṣṭra ākāṅkṣāyām sañjayaḥ uvāca evam iti ādi
translated: What did Arjuna do after that? In anticipation of this question from Dhritarashtra, Sanjaya says evam etc.

original: guḍākeśo jitālasyaḥ parantapaḥ śatrutāpano 'rjuno hṛṣīkeśaṃ sarvendriyapravartakatvenāntaryāmiṇaṃ
analyzed: guḍākeśaḥ jita ālasyaḥ parantapaḥ śatru tāpanaḥ rjunaḥ hṛṣīkeśam sarva indriya pravartaka tvena antaryāmiṇam
translated: Arjuna, the son of Pandu, who has conquered laziness, who is the tormentor of enemies, who is the slayer of foes,

original: govindaṃ gāṃ vedalakṣaṇāṃ vāṇīṃ vindatīti vyutpattyā sarvavedopādānatvena sarvajñam
analyzed: govindam gām veda lakṣaṇām vāṇīm vindati iti vyutpattyā sarva veda upādāna tvena sarvajñam
translated: Govinda, the knower of the Vedas, who is omniscient by virtue of being the upholder of all the Vedas,

original: ādāv evaṃ kathaṃ bhīṣmam ahaṃ saṅkhya ity ādinā yuddhasvarūpāyogyatām uktvā tadanantaraṃ
analyzed: ādau evam katham bhīṣmam aham saṅkhye iti ādinā yuddha svarūpa ayogyatām uktvā tad anantaram
translated: having first stated his unfitness for battle with the words How shall I fight with Bhishma and others in the battle,

original: na yotsya iti yuddhaphalābhāvaṃ coktvā tūṣṇīṃ babhūva bāhyendriyavyāpārasya yuddhārthaṃ
analyzed: na yotsye iti yuddha phala abhāvam ca uktvā tūṣṇīm babhūva bāhya indriya vyāpārasya yuddha artham
translated: and then having stated the absence of the fruits of battle with the words I will not fight, he remained silent,

original: pūrvaṃ kṛtasya nivṛttyā nirvyāpāro jāta ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvam kṛtasya nivṛttyā nirvyāpāraḥ jātaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning being that he became inactive by the cessation of the activity of the external senses which were previously engaged for the purpose of battle.

original: svabhāvato jitālasye sarvaśatrutāpane ca tasminn āgantukam ālasyam atāpakatvaṃ ca nāspadam ādhāsyatīti dyotayituṃ haśabdaḥ /
analyzed: svabhāvataḥ jita ālasye sarva śatru tāpane ca tasmin āgantukam ālasyam atāpaka tvam ca na āspadam ādhāsyati iti dyotayitum ha śabdaḥ
translated: The word ha is used to indicate that laziness and the inability to torment all enemies, which are contrary to his nature, will not find a place in him.

original: govindahṛṣīkeśapadābhyāṃ sarvajñatvasarvaśaktitvasūcakābhyāṃ
analyzed: govinda hṛṣīkeśa padābhyām sarvajña tva sarva śakti tva sūcakābhyām
translated: By the words Govinda and Hrishikesha, which indicate omniscience and omnipotence,

original: bhagavatas tanmohāpanodanam anāyāsasādhyam iti sūcitam ////
translated: it is indicated that the removal of that delusion by the Lord can be accomplished without effort.

original: viśvanāthaḥ / Nothing /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ nothing
translated: Visvanatha: Nothing.

original: baladevaḥ / tato 'rjunaḥ kim akarod ity apekṣāyāṃ sañjaya uvāca evam uktvety ādi /
analyzed: baladevaḥ tatas rjunaḥ kim akarot iti apekṣāyām sañjayaḥ uvāca evam uktvā ityādi
translated: Balarama: Then, when Arjuna had said this, what did he do? In anticipation of this question, Sanjaya said, Having said this...

original: guḍākeśo hṛṣīkeśaṃ prati evaṃ na hi prapaśyāmīty ādinā yuddhasya śokānivartakatvam uktvā parantapo 'pi govindaṃ sarvavedajñaṃ prati na yotsye
analyzed: guḍākeśaḥ hṛṣīkeśam prati evam na hi prapaśyāmi iti ādinā yuddhasya śoka a nivartaka tvam uktvā govindam sarva veda jñam prati na yotsye  /
translated: Gudakesha, having said to Hrishikesha that he does not see the purpose of war due to grief, etc., also said to Govinda, the knower of all the Vedas, I will not fight...

original: iti coktveti yojyam /
analyzed: iti ca uktvā iti yojyam
translated: This should be connected.

original: tatra hṛṣīkeśatvād buddhiṃ yuddhe pravartayiṣyati /
analyzed: tatra hṛṣīkeśa tvāt buddhim yuddhe pravartayiṣyati
translated: There, because of being Hrishikesha, he will turn the mind towards war.

original: sarvavedavittvād yuddhe svadharmatvaṃ grāhayiṣyatīti vyajya dhṛtarāṣṭrahṛdi saṃjātā svaputrarājyāśā nirasyate ////
analyzed: sarva veda vid tvāt yuddhe svadharma tvam grāhayiṣyati iti vyajya dhṛtarāṣṭra hṛdi saṃjātā sva putra rājya āśā nirasyate
translated: Because of being the knower of all the Vedas, he will make one understand that war is one's own duty. Thus, the hope in Dhritarashtra's heart of his son's kingship is removed.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: tam uvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ prahasann iva bhārata /
analyzed: tam uvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ prahasan iva bhārata
translated: To him, Hrishikesha, O descendant of Bharata, spoke these words,

original: senayor ubhayor madhye viṣīdantam idaṃ vacaḥ ////
analyzed: senayoḥ ubhayoḥ madhye viṣīdantam idam vacaḥ
translated: as he was despondent in the midst of the two armies, as if smiling.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tataḥ kiṃ vṛttam ity apekṣāyām āha tam uvāceti /
translated: Sridhara: Then, in anticipation of the question What happened next?, he says To him, he spoke...

original: prahasann iva prasannamukhaḥ sann ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: prahasan iva prasanna mukhaḥ san iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he spoke with a cheerful face, as if smiling.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: evaṃ yuddham upekṣitavaty apy arjune bhagavān nopekṣitavān iti dhṛtarāṣṭradurāśānirāsāyā 'ha tam uvāceti /🔽senayor ubhayor madhye yuddhodyamenāgatya tadvirodhinaṃ viṣādaṃ mohaṃ prāpnuvantaṃ
analyzed: evam yuddham upekṣitavati api arjune bhagavān na upekṣitavān iti dhṛtarāṣṭra durāśā nirāsāyāḥ ha tam uvāca iti  senayoḥ ubhayoḥ madhye yuddha udyamena āgatya tad virodhinam viṣādam moham prāpnuvantam
translated: Thus, although Arjuna was indifferent to the battle, the Lord was not indifferent. To dispel Dhritarashtra's evil hopes, it is said He spoke to him.🔽In the midst of the two armies, having come with the intention to fight, he, Arjuna, who had attained despondency, delusion, which is opposed to that [intention],

original: tam arjunaṃ prahasann ivānucitācāraṇaprakāśanena lajjāmbudhau majjayann iva hṛṣīkeśaḥ
analyzed: tam arjunam prahasan iva anucita ācāraṇa prakāśanena lajjā ambudhau majjayan iva hṛṣīkeśaḥ
translated: Hrishikesha, as if smiling, as if drowning in the ocean of shame by revealing his improper conduct,

original: sarvāntaryāmī bhagavān idaṃ vakṣyamāṇam aśocyān ity ādi vacaḥ paramagambhīrārtham
analyzed: sarva antaryāmī bhagavān idam vakṣyamāṇam aśocyān iti ādi vacaḥ parama gambhīra artham
translated: the all-pervading Lord, spoke these words of profound meaning, beginning with Do not grieve,

original: anucitācaraṇaprakāśakam uktavān na tpekṣitavān ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: anucita ācaraṇa prakāśakam uktavān na iti arthaḥ
translated: which reveal his improper conduct. The meaning is that he did not remain indifferent.

original: anucitācaraṇaprakāśanena lajjotpādanaṃ prahāsaḥ /
analyzed: anucita ācaraṇa prakāśanena lajjā utpādanam prahāsaḥ
translated: The production of shame by revealing improper conduct is a smile.

original: lajjā ca duḥkhātmiketi dveṣaviṣaya eva sa mukhyaḥ /
analyzed: lajjā ca duḥkha ātmikā iti dveṣa viṣayaḥ eva sa mukhyaḥ
translated: And since shame is of the nature of suffering, it is primarily an object of aversion.

original: arjunasya tu bhagavatkṛpāviṣayatvād anucitācaraṇaprakāśanasya ca vivekotpattihetutvād ekadalābhāvena gauṇa evāyaṃ prahāsa iti kathayitum
analyzed: arjunasya tu bhagavat kṛpā viṣaya tvāt anucita ācaraṇa prakāśanasya ca viveka utpatti hetu tvāt eka dala abhāvena gauṇaḥ eva ayam prahāsaḥ iti kathayitum
translated: But since Arjuna is an object of the Lord's compassion and revealing his improper conduct is a cause for the production of discrimination, this smile is only secondary, lacking one leaf. To indicate this,

original: ivaśabdaḥ /
analyzed: iva śabdaḥ
translated: the word as if is used.

original: lajjām utpādayitum iva vivkam utpādayitum arjunasyānucitācaraṇaṃ bhagavatā prakāśyate /
analyzed: lajjām utpādayitum iva vivkam utpādayitum arjunasya anucita ācaraṇam bhagavatā prakāśyate
translated: The Lord reveals Arjuna's conduct, which is not proper for him, as if to produce shame in him.

original: lajjotpattis tu nāntarīyakatayāstu māstu veti na vivakṣiteti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: lajjā utpattiḥ tu nāntarīyaka tayā astu mā astu vā iti na vivakṣitā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that whether or not the production of shame is an invariable concomitant, it is not intended to be stated.

original: yadi hi yuddhārambhāt prāg eva sthito yuddham upekṣeta tadā nānucitaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yadi hi yuddha ārambhāt prāk eva sthitaḥ yuddham upekṣeta tadā na anucitam kuryāt
translated: For if he were to remain before the start of the battle and ignore the battle, then he would not do what is improper.

original: mahatā saṃrambheṇa tu yuddhabhūmāv āgatya tadupekṣaṇam atīvānucitam iti kathayituṃ senayor ity ādiviśeṣaṇam /
analyzed: mahatā saṃrambheṇa tu yuddha bhūmau āgatya tad upekṣaṇam atīva anucitam iti kathayitum senayoḥ iti ādi viśeṣaṇam
translated: But coming to the battlefield with great wrath and ignoring it is extremely improper. To say this, the qualification of the two armies etc. is used.

original: etac cāśocyānityādau spaṣṭaṃ bhaviṣyati ////
analyzed: etat ca aśocya anitya ādau spaṣṭam bhaviṣyati
translated: And this will be clear in the passage beginning with You have nothing to grieve about etc.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: aho tvāpy etāvān khalv aviveka iti sakhyabhāvena taṃ prahasan anaucityaprakāśena
analyzed: aho tvā api etāvān khalu avivekaḥ iti sakhya bhāvena tam prahasan anaucitya prakāśena
translated: Oh, even you have this much lack of discrimination! Thus, as if to make him laugh with the sentiment of friendship,🔽and as if to make him sink in the ocean of shame,

original: lajjāmbudhau nimajjayan iveti tadānīṃ śiṣyabhāvaṃ prāpte tasmin hāsyam anucitam
analyzed: lajjā ambudhau nimajjayan iva iti tadānīm śiṣya bhāvam prāpte tasmin hāsyam anucitam
translated: when he attained the state of a disciple at that time, it is not proper to laugh.

original: ity adharoṣṭhanikuñcanena hāsyam āvṛṇvaṃś cety arthaḥ /
analyzed: iti adhara uṣṭha nikuñcanena hāsyam āvṛṇvan ca iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he covers up his laughter with a pursing of his lower lip.

original: hṛṣīkeśa iti pūrvaṃ premāivārjunavāṅniyamyo 'pi sāmpratam arjunahitakāritvāt premṇaivārjunamanoniyantāpi bhavatīti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: hṛṣīkeśaḥ iti pūrvam sāmpratam arjuna hita kāri tvāt premṇā eva arjuna manaḥ niyantā api bhavati iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that formerly, Hrishikesha was to be restrained by Arjuna's words only through love, but now, because of acting for Arjuna's benefit, he becomes the controller of Arjuna's mind only through love.

original: senayor ubhayor madhe ity arjunasya viṣādo bhagavatā prabodhaś ca ubhābhyāṃ senābhyāṃ sāmānyato dṛṣṭa eveti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: senayoḥ ubhayoḥ iti arjunasya viṣādaḥ bhagavatā prabodhaḥ ca ubhābhyām senābhyām sāmānyatas dṛṣṭaḥ eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that Arjuna's despondency and the Lord's enlightenment are seen in common by both armies, in the middle of both armies.

original: baladevaḥ / vyaṅgam arthaṃ prakāśayann āha tam uvāceti taṃ viṣīdantam arjunaṃ prati hṛṣīkeśo bhagavān aśocyān ity ādikam atigambhīrārthaṃ vacanam
analyzed: baladevaḥ vyaṅgam artham prakāśayan āha tam uvāca iti tam viṣīdantam arjunam prati hṛṣīkeśaḥ bhagavān aśocyān iti ādikam atigambhīra artham vacanam
translated: Balarama. Revealing the implied meaning, he says: To him who was despondent, the Lord Hrishikesha spoke these words of extremely profound meaning, beginning with 'Do not grieve,' to Arjuna.

original: uvāca /
analyzed: uvāca
translated: He spoke.

original: ahotavāpīdṛg vivekaḥ iti sakhyabhāvena prahasan /
analyzed: vivekaḥ iti sakhya bhāvena prahasan
translated: Ah! You too have such discrimination! He said this with a smile, as if in friendship.

original: anaucityabhāṣitvena trapāsindhau nimajjayan ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: anaucitya bhāṣi tvena trapā sindhau nimajjayan iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he made him sink into the ocean of shame by speaking inappropriately.

original: iveti tadaiva śiṣyatāṃ prāpte tasmin hāsānaucityādīṣad adharollāsaṃ kurvann ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: iva iti tadā eva śiṣya tām prāpte tasmin hāsa anaucityāt īṣat adhara ullāsam kurvan iti arthaḥ
translated: As if means that when he attained discipleship at that very moment, he slightly opened his lower lip out of inappropriateness for laughing. This is the meaning.

original: arjunasya viṣādo bhagavatā tasyopadeśaś ca sarvasākṣika iti bodhayituṃ senayor ubhayor ity etat ////
analyzed: arjunasya viṣādaḥ bhagavatā tasya upadeśaḥ ca sarva sākṣikaḥ iti bodhayitum senayoḥ ubhayoḥ iti etat
translated: In order to make it known that Arjuna's despondency and the Lord's instruction to him were witnessed by all, he said in the middle of both armies.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: aśocyān anvaśocas tvaṃ prajñāvādāṃś ca bhāṣase /
analyzed: a śocyān anvaśocaḥ tvam prajñā vādān ca bhāṣase
translated: You grieve for those who are not to be grieved for, and you speak words of wisdom.

original: gatāsūn agatāsūṃś ca nānuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ ////
analyzed: gatāsūn agatāsūn ca na anuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ
translated: The wise do not grieve for the departed or the non-departed.

original: śrīdharaḥ / dehātmanor avivekād asyaivaṃ śoko bhavatīti tadvivekadarśanārthaṃ śrībhagavān uvāca aśocyān ity ādi /
translated: Shridhar: His grief arises from the non-discrimination of the body and the Self. To show the discrimination of the two, the Blessed Lord said Those who are not to be grieved for and so on.

original: śokasyāviṣayībhūtān eva bandhūn tvam anvaśocaḥ anuśocitavān asi dṛṣṭvemān svajanān kṛṣṇa ity ādinā /
analyzed: śokasya a viṣayībhūtān eva bandhūn tvam anvaśocaḥ anuśocitavān asi dṛṣṭvā imān sva janān kṛṣṇaḥ iti ādinā
translated: You grieve for relatives who are not the objects of grief, having seen them, as stated in Seeing these my relatives, O Krishna.

original: tatra kutas tvā kaśmalam idaṃ viṣame samupasthitam ity ādinā mayā bodhito 'pi punaś ca prajñāvatāṃ paṇḍitānāṃ vādān śabdān kathaṃ bhīṣmam ahaṃ 🔽saṅkhye ity ādīn kevalaṃ bhāṣase /
analyzed: tatra kutas tvā kaśmalam idam viṣame samupasthitam iti ādinā mayā punar ca prajñāvatām paṇḍitānām vādān śabdān katham bhīṣmam aham  saṅkhye iti ādīn kevalam bhāṣase
translated: There, although admonished by me with From where has this delusion overtaken you at this critical time, you again speak only words, sounds, of the wise, the learned, saying How can I fight in battle and so on.

original: na tu paṇḍito 'si /🔽yataḥ gatāsūn gataprāṇān bandhūn agatāsūṃś ca jīvato 'pi /
analyzed: na tu paṇḍitaḥ si  yatas gatāsūn gata prāṇān bandhūn a gatāsūn ca jīvataḥ pi
translated: But you are not wise.

original: bandhuhīnā ete kathaṃ jīviṣyantīti nānuśocanti paṇḍitā vivekinaḥ ////
analyzed: bandhu hīnāḥ ete katham jīviṣyanti iti na anuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ vivekinaḥ
translated: Because the wise, the discriminators, do not grieve, thinking How will these relatives, who have departed, whose life has gone, and those who have not departed, who are alive, but are bereft of relatives, live?

original: madhusūdanaḥ / HERE
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ here
translated: Madhusudana:

original: viśvanāthaḥ / bho arjuna /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ bho arjuna
translated: Visvanatha: O Arjuna.

original: tavāyaṃ bandhavadhahetukaḥ śoko bhramamūlaka eva /
analyzed: tava ayam bandha vadha hetukaḥ śokaḥ bhrama mūlakaḥ eva
translated: This grief of yours, caused by the killing of kinsmen, is rooted in delusion alone.

original: tathā kathaṃ bhīṣmam ahaṃ saṅkhye ity ādiko vivekaś cāprajñāmūlaka evety āha aśocyān ity ādi /
analyzed: tathā katham bhīṣmam aham saṅkhye iti ādikaḥ vivekaḥ ca aprajñā mūlakaḥ evā iti āha aśocyān iti ādi
translated: Similarly, the discrimination expressed in such statements as How can I fight with Bhishma in battle? is rooted in ignorance alone. Thus he says You grieve for those who are not to be grieved for, and so on.

original: aśocyān śokānārhān eva tvam anvaśoco 'nuśocitavān asi /
analyzed: a śocyān śokān ārhān eva tvam anvaśocaḥ nuśocitavān asi
translated: You have grieved for those who are not to be grieved for, who do not deserve grief.

original: tathā tvāṃ prabodhayantaṃ māṃ prati prajñāvādān prajñāyāṃ satyām eva ye vādāḥ kathaṃ bhīṣmam ahaṃ saṅkhye ity ādīni vākyāni tān bhāṣase /
analyzed: tathā tvām prabodhayantam mām prati prajñā vādān prajñāyām satyām eva ye vādāḥ katham bhīṣmam aham saṅkhye iti ādīni vākyāni tān bhāṣase
translated: Similarly, you speak words of wisdom to me who am trying to awaken you. Those statements such as How can I fight with Bhishma in battle? are statements made when there is wisdom.

original: na tu tava kāpi prajñā vartate iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tu tava kā api prajñā vartate iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But the implication is that you have no wisdom at all.

original: yataḥ paṇḍitāḥ prajñāvanto gatāsūn gatā niḥsṛtā bhavanty asavo yebhyas tān sthūladehān na śocanti /
analyzed: yatas paṇḍitāḥ prajñāvantaḥ gatāsūn gatāḥ niḥsṛtāḥ bhavanti asavaḥ yebhyaḥ tān sthūladehān na śocanti
translated: Because the wise, the intelligent, do not grieve for those whose life-breaths have departed, for those whose gross bodies have perished.

original: teṣāṃ naśvarabhāvatvād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām naśvara bhāva tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The implication is that they are perishable.

original: agatāsūn aniḥsṛtaprāṇān sūkṣmadehān api na śocanti /
analyzed: agatāsūn a niḥsṛta prāṇān sūkṣma dehān api na śocanti
translated: They do not grieve for those whose life-breaths have not departed, for those whose subtle bodies have not perished.

original: te hi mukteḥ pūrvaṃ naśvarā eva /
analyzed: te hi mukteḥ pūrvam naśvarāḥ eva
translated: For they are perishable even before liberation.

original: ubhayeṣām api tathā tathā svabhāvasya duṣpariharatvāt /
analyzed: ubhayeṣām api tathā tathā svabhāvasya duṣparihara tvāt
translated: Because the nature of both is difficult to overcome in that way.

original: mūrkhās tu pirtrādidehebhyaḥ
analyzed: mūrkhāḥ tu pirtṛ ādi dehebhyaḥ
translated: But the foolish, from the bodies of their fathers and so on,

original: prāṇeṣu niḥsṛteṣv eva śocanti /
analyzed: prāṇeṣu niḥsṛteṣu eva śocanti
translated: When the life breaths have departed, they grieve.

original: sūkṣmadehāṃs tu na /
analyzed: sūkṣma dehān tu na
translated: But not for the subtle body.

original: te prāyaḥ paricinvantyas atas tair alam /
analyzed: te prāyas paricinvantyaḥ atas taiḥ alam
translated: Since they mostly do not take care of that, they are not fit for it.

original: ete hi sarve bhīṣmādayaḥ sthūlasūkṣmadehasahitā ātmāna eva /
analyzed: ete hi sarve bhīṣma ādayaḥ sthūla sūkṣma deha sahitāḥ ātmānaḥ eva
translated: All these Bhishma and others, along with their gross and subtle bodies, are souls themselves.

original: ātmanāṃ tu ityatvāt teṣu śokapravṛttir eva nāstīty atas tvayā yat pūrvam arthaśāstrāt
analyzed: ātmanām tu itya tvāt teṣu śoka pravṛttiḥ eva nā asti iti atas tvayā yat pūrvam arthaśāstrāt
translated: But since souls are not subject to grief, there is no scope for grief in them. Therefore, what you said earlier that the Dharma Shastra is stronger than the Artha Shastra,

original: dharmaśāstraṃ balavad ity uktaṃ tatra mayā tu dharmaśāstrād api jñānaśāstraṃ balavad
analyzed: dharma śāstram balavat iti uktam tatra mayā tu dharma śāstrāt api jñāna śāstram balavat
translated: in that I say that the Jñana Shastra is stronger even than the Dharma Shastra.

original: ity ucyata iti bhāvaḥ // //
analyzed: iti ucyate iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: baladevaḥ / evaṃ arjune tūṣṇīṃ sthite tadbuddhim ākṣipan bhagavān āha aśocyān iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam arjune tūṣṇīm sthite tad buddhim ākṣipan bhagavān āha aśocyān iti
translated: Balarama. Thus, when Arjuna remained silent, the Lord said, Asoka etc., rejecting his understanding.

original: he arjuna /
analyzed: he arjuna
translated: O Arjuna,

original: aśocyān śocitum ayogyān eva dhārtarāṣṭrāṃs tvaṃ anvaśocaḥ śocitavān asi /
analyzed: a śocyān śocitum a yogyān eva dhārtarāṣṭrān tvam anvaśocaḥ śocitavān asi
translated: You grieved for the sons of Dhritarashtra, who are not fit to be grieved for.

original: tathā māṃ prati prajñāvādān prajñāvatām iva vacanāni dṛṣṭvemaṃ svajanam ity ādīni /
analyzed: tathā mām prati prajñā vādān prajñāvatām iva vacanāni dṛṣṭvā imam sva janam iti ādīni
translated: Similarly, seeing the words of the wise like This is my kinsman etc. towards me,

original: kathaṃ bhīṣmam ity ādīni ca bhāṣase /
analyzed: katham bhīṣmam iti ādīni ca bhāṣase
translated: and also saying How can I kill Bhishma etc.,

original: na ca te prajñāleśo 'py astīti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na ca te prajñā leśaḥ api asti iti bhāvaḥ
translated: it is understood that you do not have even a trace of wisdom.

original: ye tu prajñāvantas te gatāsūn nirgataprāṇān sthūladehān /
analyzed: ye tu prajñāvantaḥ te gatāsūn nirgata prāṇān sthūla dehān
translated: But those who are wise, they see the dead bodies, the gross bodies from which the life has departed.

original: agatāsūṃś cānirgataprāṇān sūkṣmadehāṃś ca /
analyzed: a gata asūn ca a nirgata prāṇān sūkṣma dehān ca
translated: But those who are wise do not grieve for the dead, those whose gross bodies have departed, nor for the living, those whose subtle bodies have not departed.

original: śabdād ātmanaś ca na śocanti /
analyzed: śabdāt ātmanaḥ ca na śocanti
translated: Nor for the Self, on account of the word (in the text).

original: ayam arthaḥ śokaḥ sthūladehānāṃ vināśitvāt /
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ śokaḥ sthūladehānām vināśi tvāt
translated: This is the meaning: Grief is for the gross bodies, because they are perishable.

original: nāntyaḥ sūkṣmadehānāṃ mukteḥ prāg avaināśitvāt tadvatām ātmanāṃ tu ṣaḍbhāvavikāravarjitānāṃ nityatvān na śocyāteti /
analyzed: na antyaḥ sūkṣma dehānām mukteḥ prāk tadvatām ātmanām tu ṣaṣ bhāva vikāra varjitānām nitya tvāt na
translated: Not for the last, because the subtle bodies are imperishable until liberation. But for the Selfs, which are free from the six modifications, because they are eternal, there is no grief.

original: dehātmasvabhāvavidāṃ na ko 'pi śokahetuḥ /🔽yadarthaśāstrād dharmaśāstrasya🔽balavattvam ucyate /
analyzed: deha ātma svabhāva vidām na kaḥ pi śoka hetuḥ  yad artha śāstrāt dharma śāstrasya  balavat tvam ucyate
translated: For those who know the nature of the Self as the body, there is no cause of grief at all.🔽For what purpose is it said that the science of Dharma is stronger than the science of wealth?

original: tat kila tato 'pi balavatā jñānaśāstreṇa pratyucyate /
analyzed: tat kila balavatā jñāna śāstreṇa pratyucyate
translated: That is replied to by the stronger science of knowledge.

original: tasmād aśocye śocyabhramaḥ pāmarasādhāraṇaḥ paṇḍitasya te na yogya iti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: tasmāt aśocye śocya bhramaḥ pāmara sādhāraṇaḥ paṇḍitasya te na yogyaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, the delusion of grief over what is not to be grieved for, which is common to the ignorant, is not proper for you, who are wise. This is the meaning.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: na tv evāhaṃ jātu nāsaṃ na tvaṃ neme janādhipāḥ /
analyzed: na tu eva aham jātu na āsam na tvam na ime janādhipāḥ
translated: But I never was not, nor were you, nor these Lords of men;

original: na caiva na bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarve vayam ataḥ param ////
analyzed: na ca eva na bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarve vayam atas param
translated: Nor in the future shall we all cease to be.

original: śrīdharaḥ / aśocyatve hetum āha na tv evāham iti /
translated: Sridhar: The reason for not being to be grieved for is stated by But I never was not, nor were you.

original: yathāhaṃ parameśvaro jātu kadācit līlāvigrahasyāvirbhāvatirobhāvato nāsam iti tu naiva /
analyzed: yathā aham parameśvaraḥ jātu kadācid līlā vigrahasya āvirbhāva tirobhāvataḥ na āsam iti tu nā eva
translated: As I, the Supreme Lord, never become non-existent at any time by the manifestation and disappearance of the playful form,

original: api tv āsam eva anāditvāt /
analyzed: api tu āsam eva anādi tvāt
translated: but rather, I always exist, because of being beginningless.

original: na ca tvaṃ nāsīḥ nābhūḥ /
analyzed: na ca tvam na āsīḥ na abhūḥ
translated: And you were not non-existent, did not become non-existent.

original: api tv āsīr eva /
analyzed: api tu āsīḥ eva
translated: But rather, you always existed.

original: ime vā janādhipā nṛpā nāsann iti na /
analyzed: ime vā janādhipāḥ nṛpāḥ na āsan iti na
translated: Or these kings, the lords of people, were not non-existent.

original: api tu āsann eva madaṃśatvāt /
analyzed: api tu āsan eva mad aṃśa tvāt
translated: But rather, they always existed, because of being parts of Me.

original: tathātaḥ param ita upary api na bhaviṣyāmo na sthāsyāma iti ca naiva /
analyzed: tathā atas param itas upari api na bhaviṣyāmaḥ na sthāsyāmaḥ iti ca na eva
translated: Similarly, after this, from now on, we will not become non-existent, will not cease to exist.

original: api tu sthāsyāma eveti janmamaraṇaśūnyatvād aśocyā ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: api tu sthāsyāmaḥ eva iti janma maraṇa śūnya tvāt a śocyāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: But rather, we will always exist. The meaning is that we are not to be grieved over because of being devoid of birth and death.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: athavā sakhe tvām aham evaṃ pṛcchāmi /
analyzed: athavā sakhe tvām aham evam pṛcchāmi
translated: Or, friend, I ask you this:

original: kiṃ ca prītyāspadasya maraṇe dṛṣṭe sati śoko jāyate /
analyzed: kim ca prīti āspadasya maraṇe dṛṣṭe sati śokaḥ jāyate
translated: And when the death of a loved one is seen, grief arises.

original: tatreha prītyāspadam ātmā deho vā /
analyzed: tatra iha prīti āspadam ātmā dehaḥ vā
translated: In that case, here the loved one is either the self or the body.

original: sarveṣām eva bhūtānāṃ nṛpa svātmaiva vallabhaḥ BhP / / iti śukokter ātmaiva
analyzed: sarveṣām eva bhūtānām nṛpa sva ātmā eva vallabhaḥ bhp iti śuka ukteḥ ātmā eva
translated: As it is said by Suka: O king, the self alone is dear to all beings. If the self alone

original: prītyāspadam iti cet tarhi jīveśvarabhedena dvividhasyaivātmano nityatvād eva maraṇābhāvād
analyzed: prīti āspadam iti ced tarhi jīva īśvara bhedena dvividhasya evā ātmanaḥ nitya tvāt eva maraṇa abhāvāt
translated: is the loved one, then, since the self is of two kinds, according to the distinction between the individual soul and the Lord, and is eternal, there can be no death.

original: ātmā śokasya viṣayo nety āha na tv evāham iti /
analyzed: ātmā śokasya viṣayaḥ na iti āha na tu eva aham iti
translated: He says that the self is not the object of sorrow, by saying, 'But I am not so.'

original: ahaṃ paramātmā jātu kadācid api pūrvaṃ nāsam iti na /
analyzed: aham paramātmā jātu kadācid api pūrvam na āsam iti na
translated: I, the Supreme Self, never existed at any time in the past.

original: api tv āsam eva /
analyzed: api tu āsam eva
translated: On the contrary, I existed.

original: tathā tvam api jīvātmā āsīr eva /
analyzed: tathā tvam api jīva ātmā āsīḥ eva
translated: Similarly, you, the individual self, existed.

original: tatheme janādhipā rājānaś ca jīvātmāna āsann eveti prāgabhāvābhāvo darśitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ime janādhipāḥ rājānaḥ ca jīva ātmānaḥ āsan eva iti prāgabhāva abhāvaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: And these kings also existed as individual selves. Thus the non-existence of prior non-being is shown.

original: tathā sarve vayam ahaṃ tvam ime janādhipāś cātaḥ paraṃ na bhaviṣyāmo na sthāsyāma iti na /
analyzed: tathā sarve vayam aham tvam ime janādhipāḥ ca atas param na bhaviṣyāmaḥ na sthāsyāmaḥ iti na
translated: Similarly, all of us, I, you, and these kings, will not exist after this. We will not remain.

original: api tu sthāsyāma eveti dhvaṃsābhāvaś ca darśita iti paramātmano jīvātmanāṃ ca nityatvād ātmā na śokaviṣaya iti sādhitam
analyzed: api tu sthāsyāmaḥ evā iti dhvaṃsa abhāvaḥ ca darśitaḥ iti paramātmanaḥ jīvātmanām ca nitya tvāt ātmā na śoka viṣayaḥ iti sādhitam
translated: On the contrary, we will remain. Thus the non-existence of destruction is shown. Thus, because the Supreme Self and the individual selves are eternal, it is established that the self is not the object of sorrow.

original: atra śrutayaḥ nityo nityānāṃ cetanaś cetanānām eko bahūnāṃ yo vidadhāti kāmān ŚvetU / ity ādyāḥ ////
analyzed: atra śrutayaḥ nityaḥ nityānām cetanaḥ cetanānām ekaḥ bahūnām yaḥ vidadhāti kāmān śvetu iti ādyāḥ
translated: Here are the scriptures: 'The eternal of the eternals, the conscious of the conscious, the one of the many, who grants desires,' SvetUp , etc.

original: baladevaḥ / evam asthānaśocitvād apāṇḍityam arjunasyāpādya tattvajijñāsuṃ niyojitāñjaliṃ
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam asthāna śoci tvāt apāṇḍityam arjunasya āpādya tattva jijñāsum niyojita añjalim
translated: Balarama. Having thus shown that Arjuna's grief is groundless and that he is not learned, he is made to join his palms in supplication, desiring to know the truth,

original: taṃ prati sarveśvaro bhagavān nityo nityānāṃ cetanaś cetanānām eko bahūnāṃ yo vidadhāti
analyzed: tam prati sarva īśvaraḥ bhagavān nityaḥ nityānām cetanaḥ cetanānām ekaḥ bahūnām yaḥ vidadhāti
translated: To him, the Lord of all, the Blessed One, who is eternal of the eternal, and conscious of the conscious, the one of the many, who bestows

original: kāmān ŚvetU / iti śrutisiddhaṃ svasmāj jīvānāṃ ca pāramarthikaṃ bhedam āha na tv evāham iti /
analyzed: kāmān śvetu iti śruti siddham svasmāt jīvānām ca pāramarthikam bhedam āha na tu eva aham iti
translated: desires, as is established by the Veda, declares the ultimate difference of the individual souls from himself, not so, I am not, etc.

original: he arjuna /🔽ahaṃ sarveśvaro bhagavān itaḥ
analyzed: he arjuna  aham sarva īśvaraḥ bhagavān itas
translated: To him, O Arjuna.

original: pūrvasminn ādau kāle jātu kadācin nāsam iti na /🔽api tv āsam eva /
analyzed: pūrvasmin ādau kāle jātu kadācid na āsam iti na  api tu āsam eva
translated: I, the Lord of all, the Blessed One, was not at any time, at the beginning, in the past, but rather, I was indeed.

original: tathā tvam arjuno nāsīr iti na /🔽kintv āsīr eva /
analyzed: tathā tvam arjunaḥ na āsīḥ iti na  kintu āsīḥ eva
translated: Similarly, you, Arjuna, were not, but rather, you were indeed.

original: ime janādhipā rājāno nāsann iti na /🔽kintv āsann eva /
analyzed: ime janādhipāḥ rājānaḥ na āsan iti na  kintu āsan eva
translated: These kings were not, but rather, they were indeed.

original: tathetaḥ parasminn ante kāle sarve vayam ahaṃ ca tvaṃ ca ime ca na bhaviṣyāma iti na /🔽kintu bhaviṣyāma eveti /
analyzed: tathā itas parasmin ante kāle sarve vayam aham ca tvam ca ime ca na bhaviṣyāmaḥ iti na  kintu bhaviṣyāmaḥ eva iti
translated: Likewise, in the future, at the end, all of us, I, you, and these, will not be, but rather, we will be indeed.

original: sarveśvaravaj jīvānāṃ ca traikālikasattāyogitvāt tadviṣayako na śoko yukta ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sarva īśvara vat jīvānām ca traikālika sattā yogitvāt tad viṣayakaḥ na śokaḥ yuktaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that because the individual souls, like the Lord of all, are endowed with existence in the three times, grief about them is not proper.

original: na cāvidyākṛtatvād vyavahāriko 'yaṃ bhedaḥ /
analyzed: na ca avidyā kṛta tvāt vyavahārikaḥ yam bhedaḥ
translated: And this difference is not conventional, because it is created by ignorance.

original: sarvajñe bhagavaty avidyāyogāt /
analyzed: sarvajñe bhagavati avidyā yogāt
translated: Because ignorance is not possible in the omniscient Lord.

original: idaṃ jñānam upāśritya ity ādinā mokṣe 'pi tasyābhidāsyamānatvāc ca /
analyzed: idam jñānam upāśritya iti ādinā mokṣe tasya abhidāsyamāna tvāt ca
translated: And because it is going to be said that it is also in liberation by the passage beginning, Having resorted to this knowledge.

original: na cābhedajñasyāpi harer bādhitānuvṛttinyāyeneyam arjunādibhedadṛṣṭir iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca abheda jñasya api hareḥ bādhita anuvṛtti nyāyena iyam arjuna ādi bheda dṛṣṭiḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that this perception of Arjuna's difference, even in Hari who knows non-difference, is in the manner of the persistence of what is annulled.

original: tathā saty upadeśāsiddheḥ /
analyzed: tathā sati upadeśa asiddheḥ
translated: Because if that were so, the teaching would not be established.

original: marumarīcikādāv udakabuddhir bādhitāpy anuvartamānā mithyārthaviṣayatvaniścayān nodakāharaṇādau pravartayed evam abhedabodhabādhitāpy
analyzed: maru marīcika ādau udaka buddhiḥ bādhitā api anuvartamānā mithyā artha viṣaya tva niścayāt na udaka āharaṇa ādau pravartayet evam abheda bodha bādhitā api
translated: Even though the cognition of water in a mirage, etc., which persists even when annulled, would not cause one to engage in bringing water, etc., because of the ascertainment that it has a false object, in the same way, even though the perception of difference is annulled by the knowledge of non-difference,

original: tattvaniścayān nopadeśādau pravartayiṣyatīti yat kiñcid etat /
analyzed: tattva niścayāt nā upadeśa ādau pravartayiṣyati iti yat kiñcid etat
translated: it will not cause one to engage in the teaching, etc., because of the ascertainment of the truth. This is all mere speculation.

original: nanu phalavaty ajñāte 'rthe śāstratātparyavīkṣaṇāt tādṛśo 'bhedas tātparyaviṣayo vaiphalyāj jñātatvāc ca /
analyzed: nanu phalavati ajñāte rthe śāstra tātparya vīkṣaṇāt tādṛśaḥ bhedaḥ tātparya viṣayaḥ vaiphalyāt jñāta tvāt ca
translated: But if the object is known to be fruitful, then such non-difference, which is the content of the purport of the scriptures, would not be the content of the purport, because of its futility and because it is known.

original: bhedas tadviṣayo na syāt /
analyzed: bhedaḥ tad viṣayaḥ na syāt
translated: But difference would not be its content.

original: kintu adbhyo vā eṣa prātar udety apaḥ sāyaṃ praviśati ity ādiśrutyarthavad anuvādya eva sa iti cen mandam etat /
analyzed: kintu adbhyaḥ vai eṣa prātar udeti apaḥ sāyam praviśati iti ādi śruti artha vat anuvādyaḥ eva saḥ iti ced mandam etat
translated: But rather, he is only the object of praise, like the meaning of the scriptures beginning with, He rises from the waters in the morning and enters the waters in the evening. If this is argued, this is weak.

original: pṛthag ātmānaṃ preritāraṃ ca matvā juṣṭas tatas tenāmṛtatvam eti ŚvetU / ity ādinā bheda evāmṛtatvaphalaśravaṇāt /
analyzed: pṛthak ātmānam preritāram ca matvā juṣṭaḥ tatas tena amṛta tvam eti śvā tu iti ādinā bhedaḥ eva amṛta tva phala śravaṇāt
translated: And having known the self and the impeller to be distinct, he attains immortality by pleasing him. (Svet. Up. 4.6) and so on, because only difference is stated as the fruit of immortality.

original: viruddhadharmāvacchinnapratiyogikatayā loke tasyājñātatvāc ca /
analyzed: viruddha dharma avacchinna pratiyogika tayā loke tasya ajñāta tvāt ca
translated: And because it is unknown in the world due to having a counter-correlate qualified by contradictory properties.

original: te ca dharmā vibhutvāṇutvasvāmitvabhṛtyatvādayaḥ śāstraikagamyā mitho viruddhā bodhyāḥ /
analyzed: te ca dharmāḥ vibhu tva aṇu tva svāmi tva bhṛtya tva ādayaḥ śāstra eka gamyāḥ mithas viruddhāḥ bodhyāḥ
translated: And those properties, such as being all-pervading, atomic, being the master, being the servant, etc., which are to be understood as mutually contradictory and knowable only through scripture,

original: abhedas tv aphalas tatra phalānaṅgīkārāt /
analyzed: abhedaḥ tu aphalaḥ tatra phala anaṅgīkārāt
translated: but non-difference has no fruit there, because no fruit is accepted.

original: ajñātaś ca śaśaśṛṅgavad asattvāt /
analyzed: a jñātaḥ ca śaśa śṛṅga vat a sattvāt
translated: And it is unknown, like the horn of a hare, because it does not exist.

original: tasmāt paramārthikas tadbhedaḥ siddhaḥ ////
analyzed: tasmāt paramārthikaḥ tad bhedaḥ siddhaḥ
translated: Therefore, the difference between them is established as ultimate.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita)

original: dehino 'smin yathā dehe kaumāraṃ yauvanaṃ jarā /
analyzed: dehinaḥ u smin yathā dehe kaumāram yauvanam jarā
translated: As childhood, youth, and old age occur in this body of the embodied soul,

original: tathā dehāntaraprāptir dhīras tatra na muhyati ////
analyzed: tathā deha antara prāptiḥ dhīraḥ tatra na muhyati
translated: so the attainment of another body occurs. The wise one is not deluded there.

original: śrīdharaḥ / nanv īśvarasya tava janmādiśūnyatvaṃ satyam eva /
analyzed: eva
translated: (Sridhar) Well, it is true that you, the Lord, are devoid of birth, etc.

original: jīvānāṃ tu janmamaraṇe prasiddhe /
analyzed: jīvānām tu janma maraṇe prasiddhe
translated: But birth and death of the individual souls are well-known.

original: tatrāha dehina ity ādi /
analyzed: tatra āha dehinaḥ iti ādi
translated: In that context, he says the embodied soul, etc.

original: dehino dehābhimānino jīvasya yathāsmin sthūladehe kaumārādyavasthās taddehanibandhanā eva /
analyzed: dehinaḥ deha abhimāninaḥ jīvasya yathā asmin sthūla dehe kaumāra ādi avasthāḥ tad deha nibandhanāḥ eva
translated: As childhood, etc., states occur in this gross body of the embodied soul, the individual soul who has the notion of the body, they are bound to that body alone.

original: na tu svataḥ /
analyzed: na tu svatas
translated: But not by itself.

original: pūrvāvāsthānāśe /
analyzed: pūrva avāsthāna āśe
translated: When the previous body perishes.

original: vasthāntarotpattāv api sa evāham iti pratyabhijñānāt /
analyzed: vasthā antara utpattau api saḥ eva aham iti pratyabhijñānāt
translated: Even when a different state arises, there is recognition as 'I am the same'.

original: tathaiva etaddehanāśe dehāntaraprāptir api liṅgadehanibandhanaiva /
analyzed: tathā eva etad dehanāśe deha antara prāptiḥ api liṅga deha nibandhanā eva
translated: In the same way, even when this body perishes and another body is obtained, it is also based on the subtle body.

original: na tāvad ātmano nāśaḥ /
analyzed: na tāvat ātmanaḥ nāśaḥ
translated: First of all, there is no destruction of the self.

original: jātamātrasya pūrvasaṃskāreṇa stanyapānādau pravṛttidarśanāt /
analyzed: jāta mātrasya pūrva saṃskāreṇa stanya pāna ādau pravṛtti darśanāt
translated: Because activity is seen in the newborn due to previous impressions, such as drinking breast milk.

original: ato dhīro dhīmān tatra tayor dehanāśotpattyor na muhyati /
analyzed: atas dhīraḥ dhīmān tatra tayoḥ deha nāśa utpattyoḥ na muhyati
translated: Therefore, the wise one, the intelligent one, is not deluded in that regard, regarding the destruction and arising of the body.

original: ātmaiva mṛto jātaś ceti na manyate ////
analyzed: ātmā eva mṛtaḥ jātaḥ ca iti na manyate
translated: He does not think 'the self is born or dies'.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: nanu cātmasambandhena deho 'pi prītyāspadaṃ syāt /🔽dehasambandhena putrabhrātrādayo 'pi /
analyzed: nanu ca ātma sambandhena prīti āspadam syāt  deha sambandhena putra bhrātṛ ādayaḥ pi
translated: But even the body would be the object of affection by its connection with the self.🔽Sons, brothers, etc. would also be so by their connection with the body.

original: tatsambandhena tatputrādayo 'pi /
analyzed: tad sambandhena tad putra ādayaḥ pi
translated: And their sons, etc. would also be so by their connection with them.

original: atas teṣāṃ nāśe śokaḥ syād eveti ced ata āha dehina iti /🔽dehino jīvasyāsmin dehe kaumāra kaumāraṃ kaumāraprāptir bhavati /
analyzed: atas teṣām nāśe śokaḥ syāt evā iti ced atas āha dehinaḥ iti  dehinaḥ jīvasya asmin dehe kaumāra kaumāram kaumāra prāptiḥ bhavati
translated: So grief would arise at their destruction. If this is argued, then he says 'of the embodied one'.🔽Of the embodied one, the individual soul, there is the attainment of boyhood in this body.

original: tataḥ kaumāranāśānantaraṃ jarāprāptir yathā tathaiva dehāntaraprāptir iti /
analyzed: tatas kaumāra nāśa anantaram jarā prāptiḥ yathā tathā eva deha antara prāptiḥ iti
translated: Then, after the destruction of boyhood, the attainment of old age, in the same way, the attainment of another body.

original: tatas cātmasambandhināṃ kaumārādīnāṃ prītyāspadānāṃ nāśe yathā śoko na kriyate tathā dehasyāpi ātmasambandhinaḥ prītyāspadasya nāśe śoko
analyzed: tatas ca ātma sambandhinām kaumāra ādīnām prīti āspadānām nāśe yathā śokaḥ na kriyate tathā dehasya api ātma sambandhinaḥ prīti āspadasya nāśe śokaḥ
translated: And just as grief is not felt at the destruction of the objects of affection related to the self, such as childhood, etc., so also grief should not be felt at the destruction of the body, which is related to the self and is an object of affection.

original: na kartavyaḥ /🔽yauvanasya nāśe jarāprāptau śoko jāyate iti cet kaumārasya nāśe yauvanaprāptau
analyzed: na kartavyaḥ  yauvanasya nāśe jarā prāptau śokaḥ jāyate iti ced kaumārasya nāśe yauvana prāptau
translated: It should not be felt.🔽If it is argued that grief arises when youth is destroyed and old age is attained, then joy also arises when childhood is destroyed and youth is attained.

original: harṣo 'pi jāyate ity ato bhīṣmadroṇādīnāṃ jīrṇadehanāśe khalu navyadehāntaraprāptau
analyzed: jāyate iti atas bhīṣma droṇa ādīnām jīrṇa deha nāśe khalu navya deha antara prāptau
translated: Therefore, when the old bodies of Bhishma, Drona, etc. are destroyed and new bodies are attained,

original: tarhi harṣaḥ kriyatām iti bhāvaḥ /🔽yad vā / ekasminn api dehe kaumārādīnāṃ yathā prāptis tathaivaikasyāpi
analyzed: tarhi harṣaḥ kriyatām iti bhāvaḥ  yat vai ekasmin api dehe kaumāra ādīnām yathā prāptiḥ tathā eva ekasya api
translated: joy should be felt, this is the idea.

original: dehino jīvasya nānādehānāṃ prāptir iti ////
analyzed: dehinaḥ jīvasya nānā dehānām prāptiḥ iti
translated: Or, just as childhood, etc. are attained in the same body, so also for the individual soul, the experiencer, many bodies are attained.

original: baladevaḥ / nanu bhīṣmādidehāvacchinnānām ātmanāṃ nityatve 'pi taddehānāṃ tadbhogāyatanānāṃ nāśe yuktaḥ śoka iti cet tatrāha dehino 'sminn
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu bhīṣma ādi deha avacchinnānām ātmanām nitya tve tad dehānām tad bhogāyatanānām nāśe yuktaḥ śokaḥ iti ced tatra āha dehinaḥ smin
translated: Balarama. If it is argued that when the bodies of Bhishma, etc. are destroyed, the abodes of their enjoyment, grief is proper, then he says of the embodied one

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: in this.

original: traikālikā bahavo dehā yasya santi /
analyzed: traikālikāḥ bahavaḥ dehāḥ yasya santi
translated: He who has many bodies belonging to the three times.

original: tasya dehino jīvasyāsmin vartamāne dehe kramāt kaumārayauvanajarās tisro 'vasthā bhavanti /
analyzed: tasya dehinaḥ jīvasya asmin vartamāne dehe kramāt kaumāra yauvana jarāḥ tisraḥ vasthāḥ bhavanti
translated: For that embodied soul, in this present body, there are three stages: childhood, youth, and old age.

original: tāsām ātmasambandhināṃ tadbhogopayuktānāṃ pūrvapūrvavināśena paraparaprāptau
analyzed: tāsām ātma sambandhinām tad bhoga upayuktānām pūrva pūrva vināśena para para prāptau
translated: When those, which are connected with the self and useful for its enjoyment, are attained one after another by the destruction of the previous ones,

original: yathā na śokas tathaiva taddehavināśe sati dehāntaraprāptir yayātiyauvanaprāptinyāyena harṣahetur eveti /
analyzed: yathā na śokaḥ tathā eva tad deha vināśe sati deha antara prāptiḥ yayāti yauvana prāpti nyāyena harṣa hetuḥ eva iti
translated: just as there is no sorrow, so also when that body is destroyed, the attainment of another body is the cause of joy, like the attainment of full youth.

original: na taddehavināśahetukaḥ śokas tavocita iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tad deha vināśa hetukaḥ śokaḥ tava ucitaḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, sorrow caused by the destruction of that body is not proper for you. This is the idea.

original: dhīro dhīmān dehasvabhāvajīvakarmavipākasvarūpajñaḥ /
analyzed: dhīraḥ dhīmān deha svabhāva jīva karma vipāka svarūpa jñaḥ
translated: The wise one, the intelligent one, knows the nature of the body, the nature of the soul, and the nature of the ripening of actions.

original: atra dehina ity ekavacanaṃ jātyabhiprāyeṇa bodhyaṃ pūrvatrātmabahutvokteḥ /
analyzed: atra dehinaḥ iti ekavacanam jāti abhiprāyeṇa bodhyam pūrvatra ātma bahutva ukteḥ
translated: Here, the singular number in embodied should be understood to be intended for the class, because plurality of selves is mentioned earlier.

original: atrāhuḥ eka eva viśuddhātmā tasyāvidyayāparicchinnasya tasyāṃ pratibimbitasya vā nānātmatvam /
analyzed: atra āhuḥ ekaḥ eva viśuddha ātmā tasya avidyayā aparicchinnasya tasyām pratibimbitasya vā nānā ātma tvam
translated: Here they say: The one pure self, when not limited by ignorance of that, or reflected in that, has many selves.

original: śrutiś caivam āha ākāśam ekaṃ hi yathā ghaṭādiṣu pṛthag bhavet /
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca evam āha ākāśam ekam hi yathā ghaṭa ādiṣu pṛthak bhavet
translated: And the scripture says thus: Just as space is one, yet exists separately in pots and so on,

original: tathātmaiko hy anekastho jalādhāreṣv ivāṃśumān iti /
analyzed: tathā ātmā ekaḥ hi aneka sthaḥ jala ādhāreṣu iva aṃśumān iti
translated: in the same way, the self, though one, exists in many places, like the sun in water-containers.

original: tadvijñānena tasya vināśe tu tannānātvanivṛttyā tadaikyaṃ sidhyatīty ekavacanenaitat pārthasārathir āheti /
analyzed: tad vijñānena tasya vināśe tu tad nānātva nivṛttyā tad aikyam sidhyati iti ekavacanena etat pārthasārathiḥ āha iti
translated: But when it is destroyed by the knowledge of that, then its oneness is established by the cessation of its manifoldness. Thus, the charioteer of Arjuna has said this with the word one.

original: tanmandaṃ jaḍayā tayā caitanyarāśeś chedāsambhavāt /
analyzed: tat mandam jaḍayā tayā caitanya rāśeḥ cheda asambhavāt
translated: That is slow, because that dull [knowledge] cannot cut off the mass of consciousness.

original: tair api tadviṣayatvānaṅgīkārāc ca /
analyzed: taiḥ api tad viṣaya tva anaṅgīkārāt ca
translated: And because they also do not accept that [knowledge] as having that [mass of consciousness] as its object.

original: vāstave cchede vikāritvādyāpattiḥ ṭaṅkachinnapāṣāṇavat syāt nīrūpasya vibhoḥ pratibimbāsambhavāc ca /
analyzed: vāstave chede vikāri tva ādi āpattiḥ ṭaṅka chinna pāṣāṇa vat syāt nīrūpasya vibhoḥ pratibimba asambhavāt ca
translated: And if there were real cutting, there would be the fault of being changeable, like a stone cut by a chisel, and because a reflection cannot occur for the formless all-pervading [consciousness].

original: anyathākāśādigādīnāṃ tadāpattiḥ /
analyzed: anyathā ākāśa ādiś ādīnām tad āpattiḥ
translated: Otherwise, there would be the fault of [the all-pervading consciousness] being in space and so on.

original: na ca pratītyanyathānupapattir evākāśasya pratibimbe mānaṃ tadvartigrahanakṣatraprabhāmaṇḍalaṃ tasyiavāmbhasi bhāsamānatvena pratīteḥ
analyzed: na ca pratīti anyathā anupapattiḥ eva ākāśasya pratibimbe mānam tad varti graha nakṣatra prabhā maṇḍalam bhāsamāna tvena pratīteḥ
translated: And the non-apprehension of anything else is not a valid means of knowledge for the reflection of space, because the circle of light of the planets and stars existing in it are perceived as shining in the water.

original: ākāśam ekaṃ hi iti śrutis tu paramātmaviṣayā
analyzed: ākāśam ekam hi iti śrutiḥ tu paramātma viṣayā
translated: But the Vedic statement Space is one indeed refers to the supreme self.

original: tasyākāśavat sūryavac ca bahuvṛttikatvaṃ vadatīty aviruddham /
analyzed: tasya ākāśa vat sūrya vat ca bahu vṛttika tvam vadati iti aviruddham
translated: It speaks of that [supreme self] having many activities like space and the sun, so there is no contradiction.

original: na cātmaikyasyopadeṣṭā sambhavati /
analyzed: na ca ātma aikyasya upadeṣṭā sambhavati
translated: And there is no possibility of a teacher of the oneness of the self.

original: sa hi tattvavin na vā /
analyzed: sa hi tattva vid na vā
translated: For he is either a knower of the truth or not.

original: ādye 'dvitīyam ātmānaṃ vijānatas tasyopadeśyāparisphūrtiḥ /
analyzed: ādye dvitīyam ātmānam vijānataḥ tasya upadeśya a parisphūrtiḥ
translated: In the first case, for one who knows the self to be non-dual, the object of instruction is not clearly perceived.

original: antye tv ajñatvād eva nātmajñānopadeṣṭṛtvam /
analyzed: antye tu ajña tvāt eva na ātma jñāna upadeṣṭṛ tvam
translated: But in the last case, because of ignorance itself, there is no capacity to teach the knowledge of the Self.

original: bādhitānuvṛttyāśrayaṇaṃ tu pūrvanirastam ////
analyzed: bādhita anuvṛtti āśrayaṇam tu pūrva nirastam
translated: But the acceptance of the persistence of what is annulled has been refuted earlier.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita)

original: mātrāsparśās tu kaunteya śītoṣṇasukhaduḥkhadāḥ /
analyzed: mātrā sparśāḥ tu kaunteya śīta uṣṇa sukha duḥkha dāḥ
translated: But the contacts of the senses, O son of Kunti, give rise to cold, heat, pleasure, and pain.

original: āgamāpāyino 'nityās tāṃs titikṣasva bhārata ////
analyzed: āgama apāyinaḥ nityāḥ tān titikṣasva bhārata
translated: They are impermanent, subject to coming and going; bear with them, O descendant of Bharata.

original: śrīdharaḥ / nanu tān ahaṃ na śocāmi /
analyzed: na śocāmi
translated: Sridhar says: But I do not grieve over them.

original: kintu tadviyogādiduḥkhabhājaṃ mām eveti cet tatrāha mātrāsparśā iti /
analyzed: kintu tad viyoga ādi duḥkha bhājam mām eva iti ced tatra āha mātrā sparśāḥ iti
translated: But I am the one who suffers from the sorrow of separation from them. If this is said, then he says, The contacts of the senses, etc..

original: mīyante jāyante viṣayā ābhir iti mātrā indriyavṛttayaḥ /
analyzed: mīyante jāyante viṣayāḥ ābhiḥ iti mātrāḥ indriya vṛttayaḥ
translated: They are called maatraa because objects are measured and produced by them. They are the functions of the senses.

original: tāsāṃ sparśā viṣayeṣu sambaddhāḥ /
analyzed: tāsām sparśāḥ viṣayeṣu sambaddhāḥ
translated: Their contacts with objects are the connections with objects.

original: te śītoṣṇādipradā bhavanti /
analyzed: te śīta uṣṇa ādi pradāḥ bhavanti
translated: They give rise to cold, heat, etc.

original: te tu āgamāpāyitvād anityā asthirāḥ /
analyzed: te tu āgama apāyi tvāt anityāḥ asthirāḥ
translated: But they are impermanent, unstable, because of coming and going.

original: atas tān titikṣasva sahasva /
analyzed: atas tān titikṣasva sahasva
translated: Therefore, bear with them, endure them.

original: yathā jalātapādisaṃsargās tattatkālakṛtāḥ svabhāvataḥ śītoṣṇādi prayacchanti evam iṣṭasaṃyogaviyogā api sukhaduḥkhāni prayacchanti /
analyzed: yathā jala ātapa ādi saṃsargāḥ tad tad kāla kṛtāḥ svabhāvataḥ śīta uṣṇa ādi prayacchanti evam iṣṭa saṃyoga viyogāḥ api sukha duḥkhāni prayacchanti
translated: Just as the contacts with water, fire, etc. naturally give rise to cold, heat, etc. produced at that time, in the same way, the conjunctions and disjunctions with the desired give rise to pleasure and pain.

original: teṣāṃ cāsthiratvāt sahanaṃ tava dhīrasyocitaṃ na tu tannimittaharṣaviṣādapāravaśyam ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: teṣām ca asthira tvāt sahanam tava dhīrasya ucitam na tu tad nimitta harṣa viṣāda pāravaśyam iti arthaḥ
translated: And since they are unstable, it is proper for you, the patient one, to bear them, but it is not proper to be overwhelmed by the excess of joy and sorrow caused by them. This is the meaning.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha

original: nanu satyam eva tattvam /
analyzed: nanu satyam eva tattvam
translated: But it is true.

original: tad apy avivekino mama mana evānarthakāni vṛtahiva śokamohavyāptaṃ duḥkhayatīti /
analyzed: tat api avivekinaḥ mama manaḥ eva anarthakāni śoka moha vyāptam duḥkhayati iti
translated: Even that, my undiscerning mind, filled with sorrow and delusion, causes me grief.

original: tatra na kevalam ekaṃ mana evāpi tu manaso vṛttayo 'pi sarvās tv agādīndriyarūpāḥ svaviṣayān anubhāvyānarthakāriṇya ity āha mātrā indriyagrāhyaviṣayās
